messages.title: My pledges to you
messages.content:
Ipswich has been let down by nine years of Tory government. Too many people are struggling to make ends meet while the rich have been made even richer.
I want an Ipswich where everyone can get on, not just the wealthy few. Where there are jobs paying decent wages, where our children can get a decent education and our streets are safe.
We know that won't happen under the Tories. Vote for me and together we can make Ipswich better.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Reducing queues and pollution in Ipswich
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Sandy has pushed the County Council to plan a North Ipswich Bypass. Labour will invest in buses, pavements and cycle lanes too.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: The best education for all our children
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Sandy has campaigned for better funding for schools, and to save Children’s Centres. Sandy has championed Suffolk New College and the University of Suffolk, and backs Labour’s plan to abolish tuition fees.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Let's put an end to homelessness
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will have the Borough Council build thousands of new affordable homes in Ipswich and abolish the disastrous Universal Credit benefits scheme.
With more nurses and doctors to give patients the care they need.
And no increase to Income Tax or National Insurance for 95%.
Creating 400,000 jobs and tackling climate change.
for 5-7 year olds and free school meals at primary school.
as well as free TV licenses and bus passes for pensioners.

issues.economy: £10 Real Living Wage, no increase to Income Tax or National Insurance for 95%, Green Industrial Revolution creating 400,000 jobs
issues.education: better funding for schools, save Children’s Centres, abolish tuition fees, reduced class sizes, free school meals at primary school
issues.environment: Green Industrial Revolution, tackling climate change
issues.government: Ipswich has been let down by nine years of Tory government.
issues.health: Increased funding for the NHS, more nurses and doctors
issues.labourEmployment: jobs paying decent wages, Real Living Wage
issues.transport: pushed the County Council to plan a North Ipswich Bypass, invest in buses, pavements and cycle lanes
issues.socialWelfare: abolish the disastrous Universal Credit benefits scheme, Winter Fuel Allowance kept, free TV licenses and bus passes for pensioners.

community.content: Ipswich has been let down by nine years of Tory government. Too many people are struggling to make ends meet while the rich have been made even richer. I want an Ipswich where everyone can get on, not just the wealthy few. Where there are jobs paying decent wages, where our children can get a decent education and our streets are safe.

endorsements.endorsement: "We've seen crime spiral in Ipswich as a result of Tory cuts to our police. Sandy supports Labour’s plan for more police so we can get officers back on the beat. He'll be getting my vote on 12th December!"

images.caption: Reducing queues and pollution in Ipswich
The best education for all our children
Let's put an end to homelessness
Sandy Martin - Ipswich for the many not the few
